e9738e28-be7a-4f66-a5de-59022d960b21.description: Equity & Social Justice in the Digital Learning Environment Certificate of Achievement is awarded after attending a series of eight workshops. These workshops are developed to help instructors create more equitable spaces for students in the online environment by acknowledging, accepting, learning, and acting to change systematic forms of oppression.
e9738e28-be7a-4f66-a5de-59022d960b21.name: Educator Enrichment: Equity & Social Justice Certificate of Achievement

badge_template_activities.title: Workshop 1 | An Introduction: Equity & Social Justice in the Digital Classroom - At the conclusion of this workshop, participants will have a foundational understanding of privilege and its impacts on students, a framework for the entire workshop series, and knowledge about the need for building emotional muscle in preparation for equity and social justice work

Workshop 2 | Inclusive Teaching Practices: Identity and Intersectionality - At the conclusion of this workshop, participants will gain a foundational understanding of intersectionality, practice navigating difficult conversations surrounding intersectionality, and analyze the implications intersectionality has in the digital classroom and in society

Workshop 3 | A Lesson for Reducing Bias: Cultural Competency in Instruction - At the conclusion of this workshop, participants will understand biases, identify their own biases in an online learning environment, and utilize the Cultural Competency Continuum as a framework to reduce biases in instruction.

Workshop 4 | Courageous Conversations: Creating Safe but Brave Digital Spaces - At the conclusion of this workshop, participants will understand how they may be upholding forms of systemic oppression in the classroom through silence, and learn how to cultivate and sustain brave spaces in the classroom

Workshop 5 | Intervening When It Matters Most: Bystander Intervention in the Digital Classroom - At the conclusion of this workshop, participants will have a working knowledge of the bystander effect, identify areas of opportunity for intervention, and apply appropriate types of intervention comfortably.

Workshop 6 | Moving Beyond: Allyship, Activism, and Accountability - At the conclusion of this workshop, participants will identify available university DEI resources, recognize varying levels of allyship, and develop an accountability plan to utilize outside the classroom.

Workshop 7 | Tools for Equity: Inside and Outside the Digital Classroom - At the conclusion of this workshop, participants will learn how to promote equity and inclusion in their live sessions by using various tools found in the digital learning platform, in Zoom, and external websites.

Workshop 8 | Time to Act: Wrapping Up and Moving Forward - At the conclusion of this workshop, participants will review and reflect on what they have learned, evaluate how their emotional muscle has been strengthened throughout the series, and commit to act on their learning.

6a4f136f-2adb-46db-b938-117e07fa06b4.description: The 2U Faculty Engagement & Development team hosts free professional development opportunities for all 2U-partner faculty members. This recognition is awarded to instructors and 2U staff members who develop and facilitate an enrichment seminar.
6a4f136f-2adb-46db-b938-117e07fa06b4.name: Educator Enrichment Program: Seminar Facilitator

badge_template_activities.title: Seminar facilitators earn this badge by researching in the education field regarding various pedagogical topics and/or tools; lesson planning and creating lesson materials; attending meeting(s) with an experienced facilitator to review and practice; facilitating a one-hour(+) faculty seminar through Zoom; receiving feedback post seminar.

361483f8-22e7-4b31-9c9a-4392fe8d6865.description: Tech Mentors who volunteer their time to provide expertise and project feedback to boot camp learners at Demo Day are eligible to display this badge. These learners come from multiple universities for an interactive community engagement and project-feedback experience where they gain exposure and insights from professionals in their field of study.
361483f8-22e7-4b31-9c9a-4392fe8d6865.name: Demo Day Tech Mentor

badge_template_activities.title: Demo Day Tech Mentors must participate in a 2-hour micro-mentoring commitment at Demo Day, offering project feedback and career advice to up to 3 project demonstrations as well as networking with graduating learners across boot camp programs.

32a427f5-4f00-4a26-ab71-e57492f5da82.description: Career Coaches certified in UX/UI coaching are knowledgeable in the curriculum, career pathways, and interview processes for the industry. They use this knowledge to provide tailored career coaching to UX/UI boot camp graduates.
32a427f5-4f00-4a26-ab71-e57492f5da82.name: UX/UI Career Coaching

badge_template_activities.title: Career Coaches must pass a 9-question oral assessment to demonstrate their program knowledge, coaching techniques, and understanding of current UX/UI technologies.

5bbbd8a0-a03f-4a24-9602-3374e7c59b40.description: The Certificate program offered by the 2U Faculty Engagement & Development team awards Certificates of Achievement to instructors who demonstrate proficiency in online education and digital learning by attending or watching the recordings of five core seminars. Core seminars are recommended to help instructors get started with the basics for teaching online using 2U platforms, or to gain new ideas and insights after teaching for many terms.
5bbbd8a0-a03f-4a24-9602-3374e7c59b40.name: Educator Enrichment: Core Seminar Certificate of Achievement

badge_template_activities.title: Core 1. Teaching Online: Setting Norms and Classroom Best Practices | This 60-minute core seminar will focus on best practices for faculty who are new to digital education. Whether you've taught for 20 years or this is your first term, we will walk through all the do's and don'ts of teaching online and some fun technical tips to make your first online term as effective as possible.

Core 2. Student Engagement in the Digital Classroom | This 60-minute core enrichment seminar will focus on the process of engaging with your students in quick but impactful ways. By the end of the session, you will be able to conduct a number of simple yet meaningful strategies to keep your students engaged during your online class sessions.

Core 3. Engaging Students: Optimizing the First and Last Five Minutes of Class | This 60-minute core seminar will focus on best practices surrounding the first and last five minutes of class by leveraging both the pedagogy and the technology to create engaging live sessions. You will learn to help students transition into the classroom mindset at the start of class as well as ending the class on a high note.

Core 4. Breakout of the Box with Breakout Room Strategies | In this 60-minute core seminar, we will discuss the benefits of using breakout rooms to facilitate small group discussions, practice activities all programs can utilize, and brainstorm your content as it relates to potential student collaborations. By the end of the session, you will understand the importance of utilizing this feature to engage students and create meaningful learning experiences.

Core 5. Creating Community in the Digital Classroom | This 60-minute core enrichment seminar will focus on the process of connecting with your students beyond the curriculum, in ways which promote active, engaging learning. By the end of this seminar participants will be able to identify how to create community in digital classrooms and will be equipped with the tools to do so.

skills.name: Ability To Use Synchronous And Asynchronous e-Learning
Leveraging Zoom As A Digital Classroom

3d6a2f8b-5fb7-4920-84d5-bad1a52aa757.description: The Certificate program offered by the 2U/edX Instructional Development team awards Certificates of Achievement to instructors who demonstrate proficiency in online education and digital learning by facilitating a professional development seminar at the 2022 Educators Conference. 3d6a2f8b-5fb7-4920-84d5-bad1a52aa757.name: 2022 Educator Conference Session Facilitator Badge

763b52ae-7caa-4cdb-af39-5c2857be044f.description: The Certificate program offered by the 2U Faculty Engagement & Development team awards Certificates of Achievement to instructors who demonstrate proficiency in online education and digital learning by attending or watching the recordings of six elective seminars. Elective seminars are subject-driven workshops on a variety of topics related to online teaching and learning. Elective seminars are consistently added to the schedule based on instructor needs.
763b52ae-7caa-4cdb-af39-5c2857be044f.name: Educator Enrichment: Elective Seminar Certificate of Achievement

badge_template_activities.title: Faculty must attend or watch recordings of any six Elective seminars to earn a Certificate of Achievement.

a8d73732-2d63-417b-9cad-b435533ef095.description: LXF Seminars are a series of six workshops about the Learning Experience Framework (LXF) developed by 2U's strategy team and drawn from research specifically in adult learning theories. LXF seminars are numbered and ideally taken during the six-week block. Instructors who attend or watch recording of all six seminars will receive Certificate of Achievement.
a8d73732-2d63-417b-9cad-b435533ef095.name: Educator Enrichment: Learning Experience Framework Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: LXF 1 | Introduction to 2U's Learning Experience Framework - 2U’s new Learning Experience Framework (LXF) is a collection of research-based principles about how people learn that we use to guide our partners in developing world-class online education.  Join leaders of 2U's strategy and training teams to learn more about the LXF, how we use it in our work, and how you can apply the principles in your digital classroom.

LXF 2 | Clarity, Consistency, and Creative Challenges in the Classroom -  Instructional alignment between asynchronous coursework and synchronous live sessions is key to ensuring students’ contextual learning and deep thinking activities. In this seminar participants will learn best practices and strategies that align course objectives to authentic student engagement, student decision making, and expert thinking.

LXF 3 | Scaffolding Knowledge and Practice for Student Success - Learning is a constant process of scaffolding ideas. The ability to guide students through this process from foundations to mastery, without overwhelming them, is key to quality instruction. This seminar will uncover the learning science behind the concepts of cognitive load and leveraging prior knowledge, while also creating challenging and deliberate practice opportunities for students.

LXF 4 | How Motivation, Mindsets, and Goals Affect Student Learning - How a learner feels impacts their engagement with the learning process. In this seminar we will examine the principles of "FEEL" by discussing students' intrinsic motivation, self-regulated learning, and learning goals & mindsets, plus explore how to apply these principles during your live sessions.

LXF 5 | Leaning on Your Audience to Enhance Their Learning - In addition to the expertise you bring to class, students are often co-creating knowledge and content for the course.  In this seminar we will dive into the teaching tactics, backed by learning science, that will help you lean on your audience to facilitate social learning, formative feedback, and metacognition opportunities for the classroom.

LXF 6 | Leveling-up Your Teaching: Leveraging Complexity, Modality, and Storytelling - In this seminar you will learn how to best apply Learning Science theories to create more engaging classroom experiences that promote deeper learning and retention. Join us as we dive into utilizing the theories of Complexity, Modality, and Storytelling in the digital classroom.

4a3e8c3b-54c4-42da-b1fb-f665d1c70223.description: At the close of each year, edX recognizes Boot Camp instructors for Excellence in three categories: Highest Overall Metrics, Greatest Change from mid- to end-point metrics, and Most Students impacted.
4a3e8c3b-54c4-42da-b1fb-f665d1c70223.name: Instructional Excellence Award

badge_template_activities.title: Highest Metrics: These awards go to the instructors with the highest metrics by class size or those with the greatest positive change in metrics between mid & end point. Most Students Served: These awards go to the instructor and TA that had the greatest number of student interactions and stellar feedback.

8cc99c67-2625-41a9-b3ba-f6faf84540cf.description: At the close of the year, edX recognizes one Boot Camp instructor with exceptional overall data and outstanding contributions to the educational community.
8cc99c67-2625-41a9-b3ba-f6faf84540cf.name: Boot Camp edXcellence Award

badge_template_activities.title: This award is given to the instructors that has taught 4+ cohorts, demonstrated consistently high KPIs and NPS scores, and has been active in the Boot Camps community outside of the classroom. They were highly recommended and celebrated by their SSM, RAM, and others in the instructional community.
